title: [Large-Scale] Antiviral Drug Development: AI-Driven Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Life Sciences Knowledge or Experience in Pharmaceutical-Related Tasks
context.additional_context: Work-integrated training for employees to understand virus treatment development processes

learning_goals: Learners can explain virus infection mechanisms and therapeutic development stages.

Learners can explain 3 core features of single-domain antibodies (sdAbs) (small size, high stability, single binding site), list the 4 stages of AI-based antibody development (target identification → virtual screening → molecular docking → optimization) in order, and specify AI technologies (e.g., AlphaFold, Rosetta) used at each stage.
Learners apply initial therapeutic evaluation methods, including ELISA and neutralization assays.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
